googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.earlyVotingNotesCombined: * You can vote early at the [County Election Board office](https://www.ok.gov/elections/About_Us/County_Election_Boards/) in the county where you are registered to vote from 8 AM to 6 PM on Thursday and Friday before all elections. For state and federal elections only, early voting is available from 9 AM to 2 PM on the Saturday before the election.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules: Any registered Oklahoma voter may request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Oklahoma driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetEarlyVotingDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Oklahoma you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States and a resident of the State of Oklahoma
  * be 18 years old on or before the date of the next election
  * have not been convicted of a felony, for which a period of time equal to the original sentence has not expired, or for which you have not been pardoned
  * not now be under judgment as an incapacitated person, or a partially incapacitated person prohibited from registering to vote
